title: Recommendation
content:
Hi all,

Could do with some advice. Trying to find a nice typeface for a film production company called ’Bread & Circus’. Was thinking of a classic typeface that could stand the test of time. Any ideas or suggestions would be appreciated.

G

author: garovski

comments.content: Am also open to any other suggestions - quirkey - novel - abstract etc.

I’m stumped by the notion of a circus company that promises bread too. :)

Cheers!

Must be kinda like blood & chocolate.

[http://www.typophile.com/node/12892](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408050000/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12892 "http://www.typophile.com/node/12892")

“Panem et circenses,” I believe is the reference for the name of the company. It comes from Satires X, a Latin poem by Juvenal critiquing the Roman people after they acceded to an imperial rule in place of their (somewhat democratic) senatorial republic. Juvenal commented that people were willing to give up their political freedom in exchange for “bread and circuses.”

I suggest something that creates the image of Roman type etched in marble, such as [RTF Albertan Inline](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408050000/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/rimmer/rtf_albertan_inline/).

Bread and Circus used to be a big grocery store chain in the Northeast - I think they were bought out by Whole Foods. I’d avoid looking anything like their identity.
